name: rampancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being uncontrolled and increasing quickly, especially of something negative: rampancy of The regulation is partly due to the rampancy of rabies in the region, which has posed a serious public health threat. Many interpreted the rapper’s comment as a critique on the rampancy of cancel culture in today’s society.
More examplesFewer examplesIn many areas, political corruption was a major reason for the rampancy of organized crime.I can almost forgive the plant's rampancy when it produces its beautiful pink shoots each spring.The attacks reached levels of violence and rampancy that are historically notorious.
